intro: Hieracium albovittiforme, commonly known as the white-banded hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of yellow disk florets surrounded by white ray florets. Hieracium albovittiforme is often found in temperate regions and is considered a common weed in some areas.
